content.description: Curving crack that goes though a changing corner with a finish around the chockstone.
content.location: to the right of the Crack of Lightning. Look for the Hammer chockstone near the top.

content.description:
Beautiful enduro crack that would be 4 stars anywhere you put it.  First 40ft go up a perfect hands overhanging crack formed by a detached flake (Sword). Second half goes from perfect hands to OW into a pod. Go right out of the pod to the chains.  Vertical cardio.

Bolts were placed to protect the flake section. This flake flexes and a fall on gear in the flake could be catastrophic.
content.protection: Cams from 0.5 to 4. 3 bolts protect the flake section.
content.location: Right of Lava You on the right end of the crag.  Look for a tombstone feature with large triangular blocks on each side. Sword of Damocles takes the left edge of the tombstone.

content.description: Bombay to Flaring offwidth with fun kneebars.
content.location: Offwidth at the end of the small canyon behind the pillar (to the right of Flaming Virgins).

content.description: Awkward flared start (crux) leads to off-fists to a ledge.  Follow small corner to the top of the pillar from there.
content.protection: A 5 or 6 protects the start, two 4s for the off fists, fingers and hands for the top.  A 5 is nice to protect the final OW section.
content.location: Located in an alcove near of the crag.  Look for a dog toothed flake/pillar when approaching from below.   10ft to the left of Lava You.

content.description: Beautiful splitter off fingers crack to a ledge.
content.location: In a small alcove near the center of the crag.  10ft to the right of Lichen You.

content.description: Curving hand crack that finishes on a ledge.
content.location: First route on the left side of the main cliff band.  Just to the right of a talus slope that divides the main cliff and a smaller cliff to the left.

content.description: Curvy offwidth grovel. Not as slabby as it looks.
Steep finger crack that climbs like a sport route.  Good rests to place gear before each crux.
content.protection: TCUs, nuts, and any small cams below 0.5
content.location: Located on the left side of the canyon behind the pillar.  Look for the laser cut finger crack start.

content.description: Bulgy corner hand crack loaded with small chockstones. Finished on fists.  Follows a bright orange streak of lichen.
content.location: Look for the orange lichen streaked corner near the right end of the crag.  This climb has a nice little landing area.

content.description: Few face moves off the ground lead you into offwidth to the top of the pillar
content.location: In the small canyon formed by the large detached pillar.

content.description: zig zagging finger crack up a slab
content.location: located to the right of the pillar.

content.description:
Follow a crack up an orange open corner, past a flake. Crack restricts down to nothing, leading to a big reach.  Route reaches a small stance then continues up another crack to a ledge and a bolted anchor.

Named after an arrowhead found on the approach that day and the flake on the route that resembled it.
content.location: Farthest route to the right on the cliff band before the gap.
